newsitem.title: UK: UK Treasury to sell 36.5 bln stg gilts 1997/8.
newsitem.headline: UK Treasury to sell 36.5 bln stg gilts 1997/8.

text.p: Britain will have sell about 36.5 billion pounds of government bonds next fiscal year to cover government borrowing and gilt redeptions to Treasury said on Wednesday.
The Treasury said a 1997-98 central government borrowng requirement of 20 billion stg and 19.6 billion in gilt redemptions would be partly offset by a 3.0 billion contribution from National Savings.
The government will aim to issue about 20 percent of its gilts in index-linked stock and will hope to start index-linked auctions later in the year.

"This year I am announcing that the authorities now see positive merits in moving to an index-linked gilts auction programme to start as soon as it is feasible," said Angela Knight, economic secretary to the Treasury.
"Consultations about the form of these auctions will start later this year," she said.

Of the conventional auctions, seven will be of single stocks and four will have two stocks on offer. The single auctions will be for between 2.0 and 3.0 billion stg each, whilst the duals will sell 3.0 to 4.5 billion in stock.
Some 35 percent of issues will have a maturity from three to seven years, 35 percent will be 15 years of longer and 30 percent will have a seven to 15 year maturity band.
The Treasury said it would aim for there to be liquid benchmark issues in the five year, the ten year and long-dated maturity areas.
